text: Bouteille de 750 ml obtenue via le service dimportations privées du Vices & Versa (Montréal, QC). Arôme: Odeur de brett avec une pointe de citron. Apparence: La couleur est orangée opaque avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de citron légèrement salé avec une pointe de brett et de raisins verts. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût citronné. (Rating #7731)

750ml bottle. Cloudy, yellow-ish, deep goldn colour with average to huge, firm, frothy, fairly lasting, minimalyl lacing, snow-white head. Tart-ish, fruity and salty-spicy aroma, notes of quince, lemon juice, salted lemon, a lactic touch, very cautious oaky overtones. Taste is tart, salty-spicy and fruity, notes of quince, lemon, salted lemon, subtle remnants of malt sweetness with a minimally bready touch combine with very cautious hints of oak and vanilla; astringent palate, fizzy, prickling carbonation. Well crafted, slightly challenging, if not with borderline values concerning tart- and spiciness.
[1/28/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at a bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Cloudy yellow. Funky, lactic, oak, fruitiness. Really good.
750ml bottle. Hay stack, no foam. Brett, citrus. Acide, salt, wood. Slick, medium carbo

On tap at Libertine Brewing Tasting Room in SLO, as Pacific Ocean Blue Gose. Smooth, pleasant nose of a handful of grain, dusty, with light tart fruit, and a bit of funk. Hazy medium gold straw color. Grain, sweetish malt, tangy citrus, some lemon, gentle lightly buttered toast or pastry, light spice, and thin tongue-coating maltiness. Thin body. Very pleasant, with delicate flavors.
On tap at Bottlecraft, Little Italy, San Diego. Hazy golden with a white head. Tart with citrus, light bread and some salt. The body was light. A refreshing one.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle capped at corked poured into a glass. Hazy bright yellow with medium bright white head. Aroma is Brett, medium/little guy body, well carbonated, and good lacing. Taste is tart, funky Brett, some wood, and a little brine. Nice gose.
Great big lemon and sulfur aromas. Hazy yellow light thin head. Super bright lemon tart. Soft salt to guide you home. Like beautiful clean homemade tart lemon Gatorade.

Bottle shared at Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2016, Day 2. 
Cloudy pale golden with a big white head. Aroma of citrus, vinous notes and light oak. Flavour is heavy sour. Light bodied with soft carbonation. Too sour..
[20-08-2016]
Bottle sample at Baptized in the Funk as Pacific Blue Gose. This one has a lightly musty aroma and a softly sour earthy taste. Decent.

Bottle, as Pacific Ocean Blue. Pours hazy golden, medium fizzy white head, some lacing. Aroma is very funky, basement, horse blanket, dusty. Flavor is light tart, medium funk, lightly salty, citrus, lemon, horse blanket. Light body. Solid.

Bottle. Hazy straw yellow, almost glowing. Nose is brine, sour wheat, some stone fruit. Taste is moderately sour, almost chewy mouthfeel. Flavors of light lemon, light wheat, iodiney brine, light peach notes. This is an excellent gose.

Bottle at home. Pours hazy dirty gold with a huge, rocky white head, long retention with light lacing. Aroma is salty lactic acid, soft apricot and peach esters with earthy wheat and grainy Pils malt. Flavor is tart and lactic, lemon, lime and apricot notes, earthy wheat and grainy Pils malt with salt and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.
Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a long-lasting white head. Has a fruity malty spicy weak sour aroma. Fruity malty spicy yeasty sour tart citrus flavor. Has a fruity sour tart citrus finish.
Bottle. Hazy yellow pour, with a white head. Malty, lemon zest, sour, white vinegar, and salt. Ok.
Draft. A hazy yellow beer with no head. The aroma has notes of lemons and straw. The flavor is acidic With notes of lemons, straw, and salt, leading to a tart finish.

Bottle 750ml. @ The Danish (Ulfborg) Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2016, TNO(U)DRBSG16 @ fonefan & Brugmasia House. [ As Libertine Gose ].ABV: 5.0%. Unclear matt medium yellow color with a average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate yeasty, plastic, sulfur, tart, citric. Flavor is moderate sweet and light to moderate acidic with a average duration, tart, citric, funky, medium dry. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160820]

Bottle from a friend, undated, but assumedly fresh, drunk on 8/25/16.As soon as I popped the cap, the cork (which I didnt realize this had) began to push upwards, so I was thankfully ready with the glass when it explosively shot out....Big brassy-golden with lighter hay/marigold hues, a moderate haze and a rocky, white head showing strong retention for the style.Oh wow....this is some elegant stuff....Have to respect those taking the time to properly barrel age their sour ales and it really shows here, as compared to the majority of kettle-soured versions out there. Great wood tannin and lightly toasty oak help soften the sourness, in concert with the salinity. Honey, vanilla, and even approaching lambic-like funkiness. No edge to it and seems mellow and well-aged. No overt coriander and theres tons of minerality and complex acidity. No alcohol or flaw.Every bit as enjoyable and impressive, is the flavor, which shows soft wood tannin, light oak influences and tart, to mildly sour lactic acids and light brett funk. Tight carbonation and a strong, but well-attenuated maltiness create a soft, enjoyable texture, as light salinity continues to round things out playing perfect foil to the funky acidity. Incredibly pleasantly surprised by this one, having never heard of the brewery before. Would love to try more.
Sampled from bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Gathering 2016, Ulfborg, Day 2. Unclear yellow color, small white head. Smell and taste are very sour, salty sour. Oh god why?

Citric lemon fruity with some high salt prominence, medium to high acidity, light wheaty notes, crisp, salty into the close, very nice.
Bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering, fonefan. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are brett, lactose acid, fruits, salt, malt and hops. Nice sour finish.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, wheaty, sulphur, citrus, tart and sea water. Flavor is medium sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish with some salt. 200816
Bottled at TNOD(U)RBSG2016. Cloudy pale golden, huge lively head. Lemony nose with some seaweed. Tart and slender with crisp, rounded mouthfeel. Citric with some salty white bread. Low bitterness.
TNOD(U)RBSG16. Hazy, milky pale yellow. Huge airy white head. Sour, lactic aroma (?). Salty, sour and tart flavour. Slightly milky. Fluffy, creamy mouthfeel. Really tasty.
Bottle. Hazy yellow with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, sulfur, lemon, salt and spices. Flavour is malt, lemon, acetone, sour, spices, salt and acid.

Salzig säuerlicher, sehr süffiger Antrunk. Spriztig, auch wenn die Salzigkeit im Mittelteil etwas zu stark wird. Die Säure ist dabei frisch aber an der Grenze zur Unsüffigkeit, gut abgepasst. Gut! 11/9/11/12/9/11

Sampled @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2016, Saturday, Day 2


75cl bottle. Pours slightly hazy golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of sour fruits, salt, herbs. taste of sour grapes, pale fruits, herbs and salt, okay!
Bottle from Final Gravity. Pours cloudy with a transient white head and a sour fruit aroma. There is a very salty light malt flavor with a tart finish.
Bottle - Funky citrus and corriander. Cloudy yellow gold with a decent white. Aggressive salty sour notes with a nice finish. Aggressive but good.

750 ml bottle to snifter (thanks jtclockwork). Looks good; a cloudy bright golden orange with ample white head. Smells and tastes tart, lemony, and salty alongside notes of barnyard funk. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and pleasantly tart and lactic. Tasty.

This is a truly excellent beer. From a 750 poured into a tulip. The purest and simplest gose Ive ever had. Clear salt, lacto, lemon zest, effervescence. Perfect balance of flavor and mouthfeel. Really great. Drinks like a champagne.
Salty. Not sure what else to say. Its how it is supposed to be. Had this at Libertine Brewpub in SLO, draft pour as part of a large flight.
Sampled on tap, Golden color with small white head. Notes of really sweaty and funky lactic wheat, butt, salt, and lemon skins. Ok but a bit too much for me on the stank profile

Pours hazy pale golden with tall white head. Aroma of citrus, salt, bretta, green grapes and apples- very tarty, its almost as if you can smell the taste... And speaking of taste, it is rich apple tart although not as sour as the aroma suggested, mellow fruit sweet finish. Light and crisp body with lively carbonation. One of the best goses I have had.
Bottle. Yellow pour with white head, vigorous carb. Flavors are tart, fruity, cherry and sour tones. Aromas are light tart, sour and fruit notes.
UPDATED: MAY 26, 2016 Bottle - Pours yellow white head - nose/taste of sea salt, lemon, sour lactose, funk - Lighter medium body - Very tart

On tap @ Libertine. Hazed golden beer with white foam. Intense lemon, salt, and green apple. Quite acidic and sour tasting. Theres a bit of funk, some subtle tropical fruits, and green grape. Get more of just a straight up sour beer here than anything...and quite sour at that. Very assertive acidity.
Glowing golden straw pour with no head. This is one sour gose. Nose is gose and taste is gose, but with a sharp acidity that fades pretty quickly. Lactic, citric and white grapey. Nice.

Capped 750 from Capitol Beer in Sacramento, CA. Pours hazy light gold with a white fizzy head. Tart lemonish aroma. Med body or so. Flavor is tartly lemon with some salt. First blush is Berliner Weiss, but when the salt arrives its not that. Really salty IMO. Quite drinkable.
Bottle shared. Pours a cloudy golden with fizzy off white head. Aroma and taste of tart, funk, and fruit. Slight straw tossed in.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow. Aroma is huge lacto funk, floral notes, faint spice, and some lemon zest. Flavor is nicely tart and crisp with good lemon and citrus notes, faint salinity, and faint spice. Light body.
